item.title: Paper collection contractors leave litter on Southborough Lane, 17th December
item.description:
I have observed how the paper collection contractors have been leaving plenty of paper litter on our road Southborough Lane after collection of recyclables. A lot of waste was left scattered on pavement. Contractors really need to take more care and also a waste picker should be sent to clean after the contractors collecting the rubbish. Please can Bromley Council address that?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Again someone dumping their unwanted items, 17th December
item.description:
At 13.15 today there was a lot more waste I think the JMB cleaner may have partially tidied it up.but there is a glass mirrored cabinet near to our recycling bins and where we enter the car park which is unaafe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Court, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned & Untaxed Transit Van Willrose Crescent, 17th December
item.description:
This Ford Transit Van looks to have been abandoned on the street on Willrose Crescent in Abbey Wood (top end of the street). I also note from doing a vehicle check that it has been untaxed for more than a year now. It has also been left with both the back door and the driver's door open and the driver's door window down. So it very much looks like it has been dumped there. Can the council please remove this from Willrose Crescent asap. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willrose Crescent, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two clamped vehicles, 17th December
item.description:
There are two vehicles outside Nightingale Court, Valley Road, Shortlands, which have been clamped for some time now (3 weeks at least) and they are occupying 2 parking spaces within the bays which are not for permit holders only and which are in short supply now in Shortlands. Can they not be moved to a compound in the interim?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Knights Hill SE27 around about 30 yards south of, 17th December
item.description:
Knights Hill SE27 around about 30 yards south of Ernest Avenue junction on the west side footpath (north bound traffic side) is a pole with a Yellow Line enforcement plate attached to said pole. Said pole has a A3 size or similar polycarbonate boards secured with plastic zip ties so will need a knife and ‘snipes’ to remove. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for report map pin and Google Streetview link:
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Knight's Hill, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
